column4: hello, my name is Peterson. I've installed Kubuntu (but it's not a KDE thing, so that's ok to ask here)  in dual-boot and now I'm not able to boot into windows XP anymore. I've used linux exclusevely for years, the thing is that the problem is not in my computer, rather in my school's one. I'm installing ubuntu so we can use it on digital boards, but because of other educational software we gotta have windows as well.
what had happened before winxp loader broke?
I meant that.. well, everything worked
there's kind of 1 MiB unallocated at the beginning of the disk
sorry - then /dev/sda5 with ubuntu, /dev/sda6 with swap
inside an extended partition which takes up 139 GiB
so what exactly happens when you're choosing 'Vista loader' in Grub menu?
it says read disk error, ctrl+alt+del to restart
